greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of distances between prime factors in factorization of n.
comment: A006093 and A001747 give record values and where they occur:
a(n) = 1 iff n is a prime power: a(A000961(n))=1;
a(n) = 2 iff n has exactly 2 and 3 as prime factors:
a(n) = 3 iff n is in A143202;
a(n) = 4 iff n has exactly 2 and 5 as prime factors:
a(n) = 5 iff n is in A143203;
a(n) = 6 iff n is in A143204;
a(n) = 7 iff n is in A143205;
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for primes, gaps between
formula: a(n) = f(n,1,1) where f(n,q,y) = if n=1 then y else if q=1 then f(n/p,p,1)) else f(n/p,p,y*(p-q+1)) with p = A020639(n) = smallest prime factor of n.
program: a143201 n = product $ map (+ 1) $ zipWith (-) (tail pfs) pfs
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 12 2008
